entry.title: Investing Insights: Navigating the S&P 500 Sell-Off
entry.summary: In recent news, the S&P 500 experienced a significant sell-off, leading experts to warn against making hasty investing decisions. Car parts shortages have also contributed to a motor theft epidemic, with police uncovering 37 chop shops this year where stolen vehicles were being dismantled. CRH, a multinational building materials company, is set to acquire a 99.9775% stake in Dyckerhoff Cement Ukraine, as reported by the Odessa Journal. Samsung is making strides in the technology industry, with plans to acquire its first high-NA EUV lithography machinery by next quarter, with commercial implementation expected in late 2025. JSW Cement has filed draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹4,000 crore through an initial public offering. The advice on splitting cohabitees is making headlines, particularly in relation to Molly-Mae and Tommy. Additionally, the consequences for children when cohabiting couples split up are explained by ex-judge Stephen Gold. Billionaire investor Bill Ackman has made seismic changes to his $10 billion portfolio, now holding 100% of it in just nine stocks. As summer approaches, it's worth keeping an eye out for modern treasures in your garage or loft during a summer clear-out. Lastly, many higher earners living on £77,000-plus incomes are facing a potential "nasty shock" at retirement.
